text: Christmas tinsel on the light poles.  We ARE LOOKING east Inglewood INTO the orange grid of L.A. at night when sudd we TILT UP TO CATCH the huge belly of a landing 747 -- th noise is deafening.
The usual moment just after landing when you let out that of relief that you've made it in one piece.  As the plane to its gate, they stir, gather personal belongings.
mid-thirties, good-looking, athletic and tired from his t He sits by the window.  His relief on landing is subtle, we NOTICE.  Suddenly, he hears --
You don't like flying, do you?
McClane turns, looks at the Babbit clone next to him.  Ca he tenses, holds his armrests in exaggerated fear.
No, no, where'd you get that idea?

(smiling) Ya wanna know the secret of successful air travel?  After you get where you're going, ya take off your shoes and socks. Then ya walk around on the rug barefoot and make fists with your toes.
Fists with your toes.

Maybe it's not a fist when it's your toes...I mean like this...work out that time zone tension. (demonstrating) Better'n a cup of coffee and a hot shower for the old jet lag.  I know it sounds crazy.  Trust me.  I've been doing it for nine years.
The plane stops.  Passengers rise, start to take down ove luggage.  McClane does this, but as he opens the door abo the businessman BLANCHES seeing:
Peeking out from his jacket.
Recognizing the look, McClane smiles reassuringly.
It's okay. (showing badge) I'm a cop. (pause) Trust me.  I've been doing it for eleven.

The businessman relaxes, moves off.  McClane now wrestles the biggest Teddy Bear FAO Schwartz had to offer.  Balanc this, he moves down to another overhead, takes out a topc and an overnighter.  Barely managing all this, he turns,
She bumps noses with the bear, gives a look.
(smiling, about the bear) Maybe you should have bought her a ticket.
Her?
He scrutinizes the nether regions of the bear, shrugs.
She doesn't complain.
(eying him) Neither would I.
McClane smiles, with just enough of a sigh to know he's a wistful about things-that-might-have-been as she is...mov down the aisle.

CLOSE ON A bottle of Dom Perignon as the cork explodes ac a large office floor decorated for Christmas.  A Japanese mid-fifties standing on a desk holds up the bottle triump and looks out at an adoring audience of junior executives office personnel.  He is JOSEPH TAKAGI, Sr V.P. of Sales Nakatomi, a multinational corporation.
Ladies and gentlemen...I congratulate each and every one of you for making this one of the greatest days in the history of the Nakatomi corporation...

In the b.g., obviously still at work, an attractive BUSIN in her mid-thirties, studying a computer printout, heads her office.  Falling into step with her is HARRY ELLIS, thirty-seven, V.P. of Sales.  Well-dressed, with stylish, slicked-back hair, he looks and acts very smooth.
What about dinner?
Harry, it's Christmas Eve.  Families... Stockings...chestnuts...Rudolph and Frosty...those things ring a bell?
She turns into:
Her name is HOLLY GENNARO MCCLANE, though the nameplate o door stops after the first two.  She puts the printout do on her secretary's desk.
(in reply) I was thinking more of roaring fireplaces...mulled wine and a nice brie...
Holly ignores the come-on, turns to her secretary.
Ginny, it's 6:40, you're making me feel like Ebeneezer Scrooge.  Go on, join the party, have some champagne.
Ginny slowly manipulates herself out of her seat.  She is enormously pregnant.
(grateful) Thanks Ms. Gennaro. (worried) Do you think the baby can handle a little sip?
(eyeing her) Ginny, that baby's ready to tend bar.
(not giving up) How about tomorrow night?
Holly just points to the door.  He follows Ginny out, cle not giving up.  Just then the party on Holly's phone pick and we:
where a five-year old LUCY MCCLANE races her YOUNGER BROT to the phone, winsthe wrestling match, and answers with a of importance.  An Xmas tree is in the b.g.
McClane residence.  Lucy McClane speaking.
Holly suddenly smiles.  It is the first time we've seen h smile and it speaks volumes about the person hidden under tough business exterior.
(with affection) Hello, Lucy McClane.  This is your mother.
She looks up and watches Ellis leave.  He "shoots" her wi "catch ya later" wink.
Mommy!  When are you coming home?!
Soon.  You'll be in bed when I get there, though.
Will you come say 'good night'?
Don't I always, you goose? (enjoying Lucy's giggle) Now put Paulina on the line, and no searching the house for presents!
(caught) I didn't look in the front closet under the steps!  Is Daddy coming home with you?
(hearing this, jumping up and down) Yeah!  Daddy!  Daddy!  Daddy! (on second thought) And a Captain Power!
(a little tightly) Well, we'll see what Santa and Mommy can do.  Goose, put Paulina on, okay?
Lucy hands the phone to a young Salvadorian woman, PAULIN the housekeeper.
Hello, Mrs. Holly.  You coming home soon?
I'm working on it. (beat) Did Mr. McClane call?                               *
No ma'am.
Holly hides a trace of disappointment.
Well...maybe there wasn't time before               *   the flight.  You should probably make up the spare room just in case.
(smiling) Yes, Mrs. Holly.  I do that already.                *
Holly's smile comes through again.

McClane, wearing his wool topcoat and carrying the bigges stuffed animal FAO Schwartz had in stock and his hangup b comes down the American Airlines ramp and into the termin He avoids one near-collision involving his stuffed animal act which drives him into another fender bender with a CU GIRL who looks like she's ready for high tide at Zuma.  A smiles, weaves onward, McClane looks at his own Arctic ge and then the girl as she kisses a similarly garbed boyfri
(sotto, to himself) California.
He looks around the terminal at:

FAMILY REUNIONS are going on all around his as grandparen greet grown children and their children, YOUNG WIVES gree uniformed SOLDIERS, our Babbit businessman greets a pleas wife and two pleasant kids.  It's all very traditional, v touching and not the least bit corny.

McClane watches, moved by the sight, then looks around th waiting area, just on the chance his family might be wait Instead he spots a thin, gangling black kid, ARGYLE, in a ill-fitting chauffeur's uniform.  As he waits he beats ou rhythmn on a "Nakatomi Corporation" card with J. McCLANE on it in magic marker.  McClane pauses in front of him, u
I'm John McClane.
(introducing himself) Argyle.  I'm your limo driver.  Hey, nice bag.
He turns and starts walking.  McClane paces him, still ju bag and giant animal.
Argyle.  Don't you take this stuff?
(stops) Do I?  I'm sorry.  You're gonna have to help me, man.  This is my first time driving a limo.
That's okay.  This is my first time riding in one.
TILT UP from the Lincoln emblem on the car. Both Argyle and McClane are in the front seat.
Just kick back and relax, man.  We got everything you need:  CD, CB, TV, VHS, telephone, full bar.
He looks in the back seat, which is occupied by the bear.
If your friend is hot to trot...I know a couple of mama bears. (turning to McClane) ...Or is he married?
Married.
McClane tries to get comfortable, scowls as a RUSTLING NO reveals wrappers and styrofoam from Taco Bell.  He scowls Argyle.
The girl was off today.  Hey, I didn't expect you to sit up front. (back to the topic) So, your lady live out here?
The past six months.
(thinking about that) Meanwhile, you still live in New York?
You're nosey, you know that, Argyle?
Hey, I'm sorry.  When I was a cabdriver, see, people expected a little chit chat, a little eccentricity and comaraderie, I forgot how stuck up you limo guys were, so excuse me.
(amused) It's okay, it's okay.
(instantly) So, you divorced of what?
McClane gives up.
She had a good job, it turned into a great career.
But meant her moving here.
Closer to Japan.  You're fast.
So, why didn't you come?
'Cause I'm a New York cop who used to be a New York kid, and I got six months backlog of New York scumbags I'm still trying to put behind bars. I don't just get up and move.
(to the point) You mean you thought she wouldn't make it out here and she'd come crawling on back, so why bother to pack?
McClane grins, he like Argyle even if he is direct.
Like I said, Argyle...you're fast.
(popping in a cassette) Mind if I play some tunes?
A hard RAP SONG blasts from the speakers.
How 'bout some Christmas music?
That is Christmas music.

And damned it if isn't, the Fat Boys of Run DMC doing a revisionist number on WHITE CHRISTMAS or something.  McCl gives up, looks out the window. 9       HIS P.O.V. Convertibles with Christmas trees in their back seats, Time/Temperature signs which reads:  69 degrees, palm tre trimmed in Christmas lights, intermittent West side token "Happy Chanukahs"...it is clear that Christmas L.A. style its own unique style.

TILT DOWN FROM one of the stars of this film, the well-li impressive and spanking-new NAKATOMI BUILDING.  The limo up, parks, and Argyle gets out.  McClane lets himself out which is fine because Argyle doesn't remember he's suppos do it.  They both go to the rear of the vehicle.
Argyle climbs out of the limo and stops by the trunk.
So, you go on upstairs to the party, your lady sees you, you run into each other's arms.  Music comes up, you live happily ever after, that it?
It's corny, but I could live with it.
What is it don't work out that way? Where you gonna stay?
I'll find someplace.
He looks up at the highrise lit by huge spotlights, then back at Argyle who's made no attempt to open the trunk.

Tell you what.  I'll pull into the parking garage and wait.  You score with your wife give me a call on the car phone and I'll leave your bags inside at the desk.  You strike out... I'll get you to a hotel.
He hands McClane a business card with the number on it.
(taking the number) You're all right, Argyle.
Just remember that when you sign for the tip. (pointing to the building) They're paying for it, so don't be shy.
McClane grins, heads inside.
Beautiful and -- on first glance -- deserted.  Finally a SOUND in the sterile lobby reveals the presence of a SECURITY GUARD hidden until now behind a massive desk. McClane goes there, signs in.
Holly McClane?
The Guard points to a prominent touch screen computer con
Just type it in there.
McClane is confused for a moment, then he moves to the sc He gives the Guard a look...the Guard raises his eyebrows if to say give it a try.
McClane types, "McClane, Holly".  Pause.  The screen repl NO SUCH EMPLOYEE LISTED.
Frowns...thinks.  Simultaneously inspired and suspicious, types again.
McClane types, GENNERO, HOLLY.  This time the screen CHAN shows an elevation of the building and then a floor plan 30th floor with Holly's office BLINKING.
Cute toy.
Yeah.  When you have to take a leak it'll help you find your zipper.
Thirtieth floor...                                  *
(pointing) Take the express elevator and get off at the noise.
McClane nods, moves off.  He moves to the elevators, and does his experienced eye takes in:
Patrolling a different area.
which are cleverly worked into the decor of the lobby.
McClane reacts with bored professionalism, NODS to the gu
Lots of hardware...
The guard shrugs.  McClane gets in the elevator.

McClane hits "30" and REACTS to the hyper-powered SPEED w which he rises.  He rotates his head, getting out the tra cricks. As he approaches the 30th floor we hear a tremendous THUM THROBBING NOISE.  McClane stops and listens before he realizes -- it's the party.  As the doors open the noise ATTACKS us.

McClane moves around the edge of the party, gradually spiraling inward.  He grabs a glass of Mimosa champagne p from a passing tray, sips...scowls.  Spotting open beers an ice bucket, he tosses the punch into a potted plant, e burying the plastic glass.  Sipping the beer, he moves th the dense party.  People he doesn't know throw streamers him. A WOMAN kisses him.  He grins.  A MAN kisses him.
(to himself, shaking his head) California...
Finally he queries a DANCING WOMAN.  The MUSIC drowns out words but she nods, points off in some generic direction. McClane heads that way, cuts around a Christmas tree, los his bearings.  He sees:
who has an air of authority.  McClane goes up to him.
Excuse me, I'm looking for --
Holly Gennero?
Yeah.  How'd you know?
I've spent half my life on airplanes,               * I can recognize someone who just got off one. (shaking hands) I'm Joe Takagi, Mr. McClane.  I have ...something to do with this company.
So I've heard.
Takagi smiles, leads the way.  As they approach Holly's o door, McClane notices the name there is -- again -- "Genn
Holly went to the Vault room to FAX some documents...she should be back any...
Ellis is behind the desk.  He's SNIFFLING and just as the come in he SWEEPS the back of the slick desktop with his Both McClane and Takagi catch on...but Takagi tries to hi his awareness.
Ah...hi...I just had to make a quick call, and this was the nearest phone...
(as Ellis rises) Ellis, this is John McClane... (with meaning) Holly's policeman? (to McClane) Ellis is in charge of International Acquisitions.
(shaking hands with Ellis) That explains the recent deal with Bolivia.
Ellis REACTS, runs a checking finger under his nose.
(sotto) Relax, Ellis.  I'm off duty.
(eager to change the subject, to McClane) Can I get you anything?  Food?  Cake? Watered down champagne punch?
(grinning) I'm fine. (looking through the glass) You throw quite a party.  I didn't know they had Christmas in Japan.
Hey, we're flexible.  Pearl Harbor didn't work out, we got you with tape decks.
McClane laughs.  He likes this guy.
Actually, it's kind of a double celebration.        * We closed a pretty big deal today and a lot of it was due to Holly.
The door OPENS.  Holly comes inside.
All set, Joe.  The contracts went over the wire, and -- (surprised) John...!
A moment.  Does the sound of the party stop for him?  We it.  For her?  It's more cryptic.  We sure hope so.
(recovering) I was hoping you made that flight.
(quietly) I was hoping you were hoping that.
She laughs, kisses him on the cheek.  Ellis notes the awk
(to McClane) You wife's made for this business. She know how to drive a hard bargain.
Yeah.  I remember our first date.
Show him the watch.
As she hesitates:
Go on, show him.  What're you, embarrassed? (to McClane)
A little token of our appreciation for all her work. He takes Holly's wrist, holds it up.  McClane smoothly ta the wrist away from Ellis, looks at the watch.
Nice, but one of us is three hours out of sync.  I think it's me. (to Holly, pointedly) Is there a place I can wash up?
(happy for the excuse) Sure.  Follow me.
They go out.  Alone, Takagi's look at Ellis shows his disapproval of certain snow at Christmas.
An Emory freight truck turns off Olympic into the undergr parking garage of Nakatomi.
It goes down the ramp and passes Argyle's black limo.  Th driver's seat is EMPTY.

Argyle sits in the back seat hidden from the outside worl the tinted rear windows.  He is making a drink from the b with the TV on and his rap music blasting from the casset player, oblivious to the truck passing behind him.
The Emory truck stops in front of the service elevator on next level down.  As the truck idles, the uniformed drive makes a note on his clipboard.
TILT UP FROM McClane's BARE FEET.  He is clenching and unclenching his toes.
(surprised, actually feeling tension decline) Son-of-a-bitch.  It works.
Holly sits on the desk here, watches him remove his jacke shirt, etc.  Begin to wash up in the private bath.
What are you doing?
It's a long story.  You know, I think that Ellis has his eye on you.
That's okay... (pause) ... I have an eye on his private bathroom.
McClane's face shows his relief (or rather, his attempt n to show any).
So, where are you staying?  This                    * all happened so fast I didn't even ask you on the phone.
McClane finishes drying his face and steps to the bath do
Well, Cappy Roberts retired out here a couple years ago.  He said I could bunk with him.
Oh...Where does he live?
Ramona...no, Pomona, that's it.
Pomona!  You'll be in the car the whole time...Look, let's make this easy.  I have a spare bedroom.  It's not huge, but the kids would love to have you at the house.
McClane fixes her with a look.
They would, huh?
(beat; honest) I would too.

They lock eyes for a moment, but it's an intense moment t says a lot about how they still feel about each other. Just then a man and a woman, both a little tipsy, open th door to the office, see that it's occupied and beat a has retreat.  The interruption temporarily dents the mood.  H tries to smile.  But for McClane it's the last frustratio
...I've missed you.                                 *
Especially my name.  You must miss it every time you write a check.  When did you start calling yourself 'Ms. Gennero'?
(caught) This is a Japanese company, you know? They figure a married woman, she's on the way out the door...
Sure.  It's unnerving.  I remember this one particular married woman, she went out the door so fast there was practically a jetwash...I mean, talk about your wind chill factor...
Didn't we have this same conversation in July?  Damn it, John, there was an opportunity out here -- I had to take it --
No matter what it did to our marriage -- ?
My job and my title and my salary did nothing to our marriage except change your idea of what it should be.
Oh, here it comes.  One of those 'meaningful relationship conversations.' I never should've let you get those magazine subscriptions --

You want to know my idea of a marriage? It's a partnership where people help each other over the rough spots -- console each other when there's a down...and when there's an up, well, hell, a little Goddamn applause or an attaboy wouldn't be too bad. (quietly) I needed that, John. (pause) I deserved that.
There's a clumsy pause as if she's almost challenging him say...something but he sets his jaw, says nothing.  Just the door opens and Ginny leans inside.
Miz Gennero?  Mr. Takagi is looking for you...he wants you to say something to the troops...
Thanks, Ginny.  I'll be a second. Oh, this is --
(mock bright 'radio' voice) Hi.  John Gennero here.  I'm the sensitive and supportive man of the eighties.
Ginny looks puzzled, goes out.  Holly sighs, moves to the door.
I'll be a few minutes.  Wait here --
Don't I always?
She's gone.  Immediately, he slaps his forehead, contrite
(to himself) Schmuck!

The Guard at the front desk notices the Emory truck on hi monitor.  The Guard continues to watch the Emory truck an only half notices as a Mercedes pulls up in front of the building and two extremely well-dressed BUSINESSMAN (late twenties) climb out and start up the stairs for the door. they cross the lobby to the Guard's table to sign in, we their conversation.
(animatedly) ...So, Kareem rebounds -- listen, this is a great play -- feeds Worthy on the break, over to A.C., to Magic, back to Worthy in the lane and --
Suddenly the other man pulls out a Walther pistol with a silencer and aims it at the Guard's forehead.  Before the Guard can react he pulls the trigger.
(dryly) Boom...two points.

(The speed with which the murder takes place sets the ton for the rest of the action.)  The killer moves behind the desk, stepping over a small pool of blood from the Guard. His name is KYLE, big, with long blond hair like a rock drummer.  Karl takes off the silencer and looks at the vi monitor of the Emory truck.  The first man, Theo, opens h briefcase, takes out a portable CB radio and speaks into
We're in.
the driver nods at the security camera as several men cli the rear of the van and begin unloading wooden crates by service elevator.

McClane looks at all the lavishness around him and picks phone by the toilet.  He opens his wallet and takes out t phone number Argyle have him.  A photo of his children st him. It's of Holly, the two children and himself in happier da Six months ago, before Nakatomi came calling to Holly's d McClane flips it over.  On the back in crude but painstak hand of a five-year-old it says:  WE MISS YOU, DADDY.  LO LUCY (and in more primitive letters) JOHN. McClane returns the photo to his wallet, dials the number

Theo enters the small control room and comfortably sits b a maintenance keyboard.  Whistling a vaguely familiar tun TYPES in some commands and locks down the passenger eleva up to the 30th floor.  Then with several more computer co systematically causes:

head_text.subj: THE ESCALATORS TO THE GARAGE COME TO A STOP

text: Theo finishes typing and disconnects the keyboard and pul the wires from beneath the panel.

The doors to a service elevator open TO REVEAL HANS GRUBE impeccably dressed, lean and handsome, he steps out into lobby like he owns the building -- and in a way he does. Theo steps to the door of the control room and tosses Han COMPUTER CARD. Hans goes to the front door, waves the card over a magnet plate.  An LED BLINKS and the door LOCKS with a THUD. Hans looks out at the street.  Appropriately enough, "not creature is stirring."  Century City is quiet.

An elevator opens REVEALING TEN MORE MEN, all armed with Kalashnikov machine guns are carrying canvas kit bags.  O of them, EDDIE, a rugged American in his twenties, goes t the dead guard and immediately begins changing into his c Meanwhile: A)  Karl takes a tool case from the elevator and joins hi brother TONY, first playfully grabbing him.  They head for the basement stairwell; B)  Theo leaves the control room and nods to Hans. C)  Eddie finished adjusting buttons and snaps on his pilfered uniform, takes his position behind the front des

looks at his watch and seems pleased.  He steps into the elevator with the others and presses the button for the 3 floor.  The entire sequence has taken maybe sixty seconds 37      INT. ELLIS' BATHROOM - 30th FLOOR - SAME McClane is still barefoot, his pant legs now rolled up ab his ankles.  He stretches his toes again.  Damn, it works lights up a new Marlboro, dials a number on the (bathroom phone.

A large sign says:  PACIFIC BELL EMPLOYEES ONLY.  Inside stands in front of an intimidating matrix of phone lines what he has in mind won't require a doctorate in Electric Engineering.  Karl comes over, gives his an elder brother punch on the arm, points out what to do.  Together they f on four CPV plastic conduits which run out of the main pa over their heads.  Tony nods.  Opens a case REVEALING a compact electric chainsaw.
(on phone)
Argyle...?
Argyle is reclining on the seat.  The music is on so loud it is nearly impossible to hear.
Hey, John, what's the word on you and your lady?
The vote's not in yet.
Karl cuts through the four tubes one at a time.
McClane on the phone.
(mocking)
'Vote's not in yet?'  What's that supposed to mean.
What do you want, 'All My Children'? We're making progress.  After I get my foot out of my mouth, we'll really be cooking, and then I can -- He stops and gently taps the phone cradle.  No dial tone.
Argyle looks at the phone.
What?...Mr. Mac, you there? He turns down the music but there is on one on the line.
(to himself)
Well, call me back, John.  You got the number. He hangs up and turns the volume back up.
McClane hangs up the original phone and then tries the ot one on the desk.  It, too, is dead.

Hans and the others approaching the 30th floor.  As they closer, we hear the noise of the speakers growing louder louder.  The men cock their weapons and brace themselves car stops and the elevator doors open.  ON THE SOUND OF G

McClane grabs his shoulder harness off the back of the ch moves quickly to the doorway.  He looks down the hall. 47      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. Two terrorists, FRANCE and FRITZ, armed with M-5 machine searching the offices on the hall one by one.  They open look in from the hallway, and move on quickly to the next They are four offices away and moving fast. McClane looks across the corridor and sees the stairwell -- too far to reach without being seen.
steps back, throws off the safety on his Beretta and brac himself.  He opens the door, peers through a crack at:

QUICK CUTS as McClane's eyes SCAN their weapons...he's to outgunned, and he knows it. Franco and Fritz reach the office just before Ellis' and open the door REVEALING the man and woman who interrupted and McClane a few minutes before, now in the throes of passionate lovemaking on the desk.  The two terrorists sm at each other, then enter the office. A moment later the man, (trying desperately to pull up hi pants) and the woman (buttoning her blouse) are pushed ou into the hall and toward the larger group by Fritz.  The terrorist, Franco, goes to Ellis' office and opens the do It is...empty.

CLOSE ON McClane's bare feet padding quickly up the concr stairs, two at a time.  We FOLLOW him up, then out onto t 50-A    31th FLOOR This is the mezzanine floor immediately above the main Nakatomi lobby.  McClane sees Theo and KRISTOFF wheeling of equipment.  McClane ducks back into the stairwell, he up another flight and out onto:

Eventually it will be one large secretarial pool, but onl portion is completed.  Half-finished partitions and offic furniture in its original plastic wrappings are everywher One end has a few lonely finished working areas. McClane moves quickly to a desk and picks up a phone.  It out.
Shit...

He looks out the window at: 51-A    NEIGHBORING BUILDING - MCCLANE'S P.O.V. A high-rise apartment building a half-block away sparkles lights.  McClane stares at a PRETTY GIRL in her bedroom. wearing drop dead underwear right out of the Victoria's S catalog.  As we watch, she flops down on her bed, and wit one long leg in the air, effortlessly dials a call on her high-tech phone.  It seems so easy.
Frustrated, he watches this, knits his brow.
Think...
52      INT. 30th FLOOR (HOSTAGE FLOOR) - SAME The employees have been herded to the center of the room the desks have been pulled back.  Many people are whimper
She looks around the room for McClane.  She's so intent o this that she doesn't see one TERRORIST waving her forwar Exasperated, he SHOVES her.  Her glare at him shows us he mettle.

As the employees are bunched together, Ellis seeks out Ho He's clearly scared but trying to fake courage.  He pats hand "reassuringly." Hans steps up on top of a desk and looks over the group. reaches into a pocket...several people CRINGE...but what comes out with is a Bottega Venata pocket notebook.  He c his own scribblings like a dais speaker.

(soothing, in control) Ladies and gentlemen, due to the Nakatomi Corporation's legacy of greed around the globe, it is about to be taught a lesson on real power. You...will be witnesses. If our demands are not met, however -- (sad smile) -- You may become participants instead. (beat, checking notes) Now, where is...'Takagi'?  Where is the man who... (slight smile) ...used to be in charge here?
Takagi is shoved forward.  He's worried but far from cowe Hans steps towards him.  Extends a hand.
(quite civil) Mr. Takagi.  How do you do.  My name is Hans Gruber.

Takagi is confused by his charm.  Hans waves politely in direction of an elevator and with an armed escort takes t executive away.  CAMERA ADJUSTS to show Holly, concerned. 56      INT. STAIRWELL - 33rd FLOOR - SAME McClane pauses outside the stairwell door to the 33rd flo he presses the handle and cracks the door open TO REVEAL computer floor.  The computer machinery drones on under t lights behind plate glass windows.  McClane quietly close the door and moves to another floor.
(mumbling to himself) 32 construction...33 computers...
Hans, Takagi, Karl and Tony.  Riding silently.  Hans alon seems relaxed.  He whistles.  We recognize it as a snatch Wagner.
Nice suit.  John Philips...London?
Takagi stares at him, speechless.
(smiles) I have two myself. (beat, as he exits:) I'm told Arafat shops there too...

McClane starts to open the stairwell door to the Machine when a NOISE above him gets his attention.  He moves sile up one flight to the roof.  Quietly, he cracks the door a looks out onto a Machine Floor on the lower level of the 61      MCCLANE'S P.O.V. Three terrorist, JAMES, ULI and HEINRICH, are unpacking t wooden crates we saw in the garage from the service eleva It's not clear what they're doing but it seems very milit like and ominously defensive.  Heinrich POINTS up to the ceiling and says something in German.  The others nod.  H starts to turn towards the CAMERA and:
closes the door and slips back down the stairs.
Hands enters, looks around.
And when Alexander saw the breadth of his domain, he wept.  For there were no more worlds to conquer. (to Takagi) The benefits of a classical education.
Hans admired a scale model of a bridge.  Behind him are photographs of the gorge where the bridge will be constru Karl and Tony listen.  Takagi watches.
It's beautiful.  I always enjoyed models as a boy.  The exactness, the attention to every foreseeable detail... perfection.

Oh, man, please, no -- Desperate, he leans on the glass...which CRACKS again, on verge of going.  McClane thinks...looks over his shoulder the body of Marco.
Powell check in on his radio.  Unconsciously he begins to HUM the Muzak he overheard in the lobby.
One Adam Ten to 6421.  We had a wild goose chase on that 436. Everything's okay here.  Over. (waiting, loosening his tie, he murmurs)
'Oh, the weather outside is frightful, but the...the uh, dum, de dum's delightful...'
Roger, One Adam Ten.  We thought it was a crank call anyway.  Clear to code eight.
Roger. (putting the car into gear)
'...let is snow, let it snow, let it snow -- ' Suddenly Marco's body CRASHES onto the hood of his car.
(terrified)
-- Jesus H. Christ! (grabbing for his radio)

6421, this is One Adam Ten -- Suddenly a barrage of MACHINE GUN FIRE from Alexander on third floor drowns out his call!  Powell ducks and flatte against the seat as bullets blow out the front window, covering him in glass.

Roger, One Adam Ten, please repeat. But Powell accelerates in reverse away from the building, keeping his head low and praying he doesn't hit anything as the bullets follow him, digging into asphalt.  A half away his car runs off the pavement and down a SLOPE, fina BOUNCING to a jarring HALT in a parking lot which is dest to become police H.Q. a few pages from now.  Powell sits and clutches the mike.
One Adam Ten, under automatic rifle fire at Nakatomi!  Requesting immediate backup and SWAT assistance...
McClane looks down at Powell and grins.
Welcome to the party, pal.
WIDEN FROM A POLICE SCANNER.  We take in the action here, all color coordination and slickness.  RICHARD THORNBURG, local TV news reporter, is on the phone to his girlfriend
(into phone)

-- of course I can get us a table, Wolfgang and me, we're like that. I interviewed him...hold on,                         * babe... He covers the mouthpiece, because he's become aware of wh coming from the scanner.
(various voices)
-- attention all units.  Officer pinned down by automatic weapon fire at Nakatomi, Century City -- request assistant -- (ETC)
(intermixed with all this)
-- guys, you want to cut through the red tape?  They practically turned this car into Swiss cheese -- !
(pleased)
All right...! He drops the phone, pick up another.  Shouts --
Mary, this is Dick.  I want a remote truck and a crew to meet me at the South gate in fifteen minutes... (listens)
Damn right, fifteen... (listens)
Where are we going? (Hearing gun shots)
For an Emmy! Now, hearing MACHINE GUN FIRE, Thornburg hangs up the sec phone.  Runs out of the room.  CAMERA PANS BACK TO the fi phone.
Richard?  Richard?
Sirens wail as the first few police cars arrive.  Powell them, waves them back, points to the third floor.
He leans back and closes his eyes, luxuriating in the sou of WAILING POLICE SIRENS.  He looks at Holly.
I never through I'd love to hear that sound.
Hans, Karl, Fritz and Franco confer.
(in mid-speech)
-- all of you, stay at your posts! We knew that police action was inevitable... (an odd smile)
...In fact, it's necessary.  So let them start their feeble efforts; until them, stay calm.  We have the hostages, remember.  We are still in charge. Suddenly Hans' CB crackles to life.
(picking it up)
I told all of you...I want radio silence until further --

169-A   MCCLANE - 34th FLOOR - BOARD ROOM He's got a CB on the table and ON, and his cop's notebook out again.  He's already upgraded the NUMBER OF TERRORIST to "12 (?) minus 3 = 9" and added other information.  As speaks he takes ammo clips the dead men dropped, their sidearms, etc.

Gee, I'm sorry, Hans, nobody gave me the message.  You shoulda put it on the bulletin board.  Anyway, I thought you and Franco and Karl and the other boys might be lonely, now that I waxed Tony and Marco and their buddy.  So I invited some of the guys from my card game. In the office, the terrorists REACT, startled, as McClane name-drops.
How...how does he know so much about --
(waving for silence)

Ah, how nice of you to call.  I assume you are our mysterious party crasher.  You are most troublesome for a...security guard? 170     INT. 34th FLOOR - ON MCCLANE - INTERCUT Moving down the corridor.  Now armed with Marco's machine gun and carrying Heinrich's kit bag, he seems more lethal
(into CB)

BZZZ!  Sorry, Hans, wrong guess. Would you like to go for Double Jeopardy, where the stakes are double and the scores really change? He rolls Heinrich over and is delighted to find a pack of Gauloise's in the man's pocket.  He takes them, pats the dead man's face.
(sotto, to the body)
Bad for your health anyway.
Who are you, then?

Just the fly in the ointment, Hans. The monkey in the wrench, the pain in the ass - McClane STOPS in mid-speech.  He's just opened the kit ba Heinrich had over his shoulder when he died.  Now McClane takes out the contents...dozens and dozens of EXPLOSIVE DETONATORS marked "DANGER" and a CHUNK of cello-wrapped PLASTIQUE the size of an electric razor.  He WHISTLES in surprise to himself. In the office, Hans turns off his mike for a moment, turn to Karl.

Check on all the others...don't use the radio.  See if he's lying about Marco  and find out if anyone                  * else is missing.                                     * He moves.   Hans goes back onto the CB.  Meanwhile, McCla SMILES at the tell-tale STATIC as Hans goes off and on. knows what's happening.  Now, he starts to walk down a corridor, eyes PANNING FROM elevator to the stairwell doors.
Mr. Mystery Guest.  Are you still there?
I wouldn't think of leaving, Hans. Unless you want to open the front door...?
I'm afraid not.  But you have me at a loss -- you know my name, but who are you? (scornfully)
Just another American who saw too many movies as a child.  Another orphan of a bankrupt culture who thinks he's John Wayne...Rambo... Marshal Dillion.
Actually, I was always partial to Roy Rogers.  I really dug those sequined shirts.
(harsh)
Do you really think you have a chance against us, Mr. Cowboy? A LIGHT blinks on the elevator.
(long pause)
Yipee-yi-yea...mother-fucker. McClane goes quietly through the stairwell door and is go by the time the search party steps onto this floor. Hans sits quietly...thinking.
Karl steps off the elevator and goes through the crowd of hostages to Hans.
(quietly)
He wasn't lying about Marco:  He's thirty stories down on the street. The other man is Heinrich, and I found his body upstairs. (pause; Hans looks alarmed)
And his bag is missing.
He had the detonators! (into CB)
Theo?  Theo!
With Kristoff, he has DRILLED TWO HOLES in the safe and i working on a third when he HEARS the CB.  He turns off th drill, answers.
Yo!
We may have some problems.  How is your schedule? Theo moves to his computer screen which shows a schematic the safe and blinking icons and the words MECHANICALS #2 and #2 DISABLED.
Three down, four to go --
Then don't waste time talking to me. Suddenly all REACT to a nearby CB transmitter which broad
This is Sergeant Al Powell of the Los Angeles Police Department.  If the person who radioed for help on this channel can hear me, acknowledge this transmission...I say again...
(to CB)
I read you, Powell.  You the guy in the car?

Powell stands in front of his destroyed cruiser and looks up at the building.  Behind him technicians, City Power a Light personnel, SWAT officers in protective gear, etc., from all directions.  A trailer is being backed into a pa lot, which will become the police center of operations. is like watching a small town being constructed right bef your eyes.
(to CB)
What's left of him.  Can you identify yourself?
Listening intently.

Maybe later.  Just listen fast because this is a party line and the neighbors are trigger happy. Now here's the skinny:  There's thirty or so hostages on the 30th floor, with probably 2 or 3 guards to cover a group that size. The leader here is named Hans, and besides the pea shooter he ventilated your car with,                            * they got machine guns and                            * sidearms up the yin yang.  On top of that one of 'em had a big enough chunck of plastic explosive to orbit Kate Smith.                                    * NOTE:  The following dialogue is said OVER McClane's.
We have to find him and shut him up!  He's telling them everything --
(shaking his head, calming)

The police are irrelevant.  We've                    * waiting for the FBI.  Until they                     * arrive, we can't finish out work. Meanwhile, let this fool waste time for the police.  Fritz, go help Uli                  * find the bag. The CAMERA TIGHTENS ON him
We must find those detonators. They leave.
How many are there?
(thinking about it)

Figuring there's at least one to cover the lobby, a couple with the hostages...I'd say they came in with about a dozen...but they're down to nine now, including the skydiver you already met.  These guys are mostly Europeans, judging by their clothing labels, and they're well financed and very slick.
How do you know?

I've seen enough phoney ID's in my time to recognize that the ones they've got cost a fortune.  Add all that up and I don't know what the fuck it means, but these are bad ass preps and they're here to stay. We notice that everything McClane has said about "clothin and ID's and police jargon, etc., has set off a little bu in Powell's brain.
I hear you... (on a hunch)
Partner.  And LA's finest are on it, so light 'em if you got 'em.
I'm ahead of you...partner.
Uh, what do I call you? A moment.  McClane smiles.  What the hell?
'Roy'.

Got it...'Roy'.  Now listen.  If you think of anything else you think we need to know, don't be shy, okay? In the meantime I want you to find a safe place and hole-up and let us do our job.  Understand?
(to CB)
They're all yours, Al.  Good luck. McClane turns off his CB and sits against the wall.

An unmarked police car pulls up across the street from Nakatomi building and a MAN in a sportcoat climbs out. Stocky, his hair a little too perfect, the very fact that he is the Deputy Chief of Police Operations on a Christma gives some evidence to his position in the pecking order. name is DWAYNE T. ROBINSON and he moves brusquely past po technicians and goes to the forward group of officers.
Who's talking to them? Powell turns around
I am, Sir...Sergeant Al Powell.
Dwayne Robinson.  Well, what have you learned?  What do they want?
The terrorists?  Don't know, Sir. We haven't heard a peep from them.
(puzzled)
Then who the hell have you been talking too?
We don't exactly know, Sir.  He won't give us him name.  He appears to be the man who called in the report...he's killed one of the terrorists for sure and claims he capped two others.
(exasperated)
He claims?  Powell, has it occured to you he could be one of the terrorists, pulling your chain? Or some kind of nut case who --
I don't think so, Sir.  In fact... I think he's a cop.  Maybe not LAPD, but definitely a badge.
How do you know?
A hunch.  Things he said.  Like, knowing how to recognize a phony
(exasperated)
-- recognizing phony ID's?  Christ, Powell, he could be a fucking bartender for all we know! Something draws Robinson's attention.  He looks at:
Pulling up and parking just beyond the barricades. Richard Thornburg gets out, starts supervising the positioning of cameras.
Oh shit...
Hans examines building plans at Holly's desk.  Behind him the TV is ON, the sound muted.  TV cops triumph over oafi bad guys. Hans looks up as Fritz brings in Holly.
I...have a request.
Oh?  What idiot put you in charge?
(evenly)
You did. (on his look)
You murdered by Boss.  Now... (waving towards the hostages)
They're looking to me.  Personally I'd pass on the jab.  I don't enjoy being this close to you. Hans is impressed by her candor.  And she's easy enough on the eyes.
Go on.
We have a pregnant woman out there -- (on his look)
-- relax, she's not due for two weeks, but a marble floor isn't doing her back any good.  I'd like permission for her to more to one of the offices where there's a sofa.
No.  But I'll have a sofa brought out to you.  Good enough?
Good enough.  And unless you like is messy, you'd better start taking us in groups to the bathroom.
(nods)
Yes, you're right.  It will be done. He nods to one of his men, and she is waved to the door: As she goes:
Mr. Takagi chose his people well, Mrs...?
Gennero.  Miss Gennero. He nods, thoughtful.  She goes out.  Hans suddenly notice
A slide "SPECIAL BULLETIN" has appeared.  This changes to SHOT of the Nakatomi building with "LIVE" supered over it Richard Thornburg is in front. The CAMERA TIGHTENS ON him

This is Richard Thornburg, speaking to you live from Century City... where Los Angeles has joined the sad but world wide fraternity whose only membership requirement is the awesome spectre of International Terrorism...
As Thornburg Continues, we PULL BACK.  We're WITH Argyle the back seat of the limo.
(reaching for the remote)
What else is new...? The CAMERA PULLS BACK and we SEE the Nakatomi Building ri up in the b.g. behind Thornburg.
(stunned)
Holy shit...

We're told that the situation began some two hours ago when an unidentified party of men took over the building and sealed off all of its entrances and exits... Argyle is already bailing out of the car.
Argyle looks at the metal gates, swallows.  He JUMPS back in the car.
Argyle pours himself a stiff drink.
(on TV)

Since all the telephone lines have been cut, the only contact with the building had been through the use of CB communicators which the terrorists brought with them.  Strangely enough, so far the terrorists have not communicated directly with the police... but an unidentified man has had several conversations which seem to indicate... Argyle nearly spills his drink as he leans over the front seat and turns on the CB.

Signs of activity along the edges and shadows of the area Men and vehicles.  The SNAP of weapons and breeches. Footsteps running in unison.  Powell picks up on this, tu to Robinson, who is standing with the SWAT Captain, MITCH
What's going on?
What's it look like?  We're going in.
(flabbergasted)
Going in...are you out of your mind? There's 30 hostages in there -- for all we know --

-- all we know?  We don't know shit, Powell.  If there's hostages why hasn't anyone asked for ransom?  If there's terrorists, where's their goddamn list of demands?  All we know is that someone shot up your car, and it could be the same flake you've been talking to on the radio!
What about the body that fell out of the window -- ?
Who the hell knows?  Maybe he was a stockbroker who looked at the Dow Jones and opted for early retirement!
Chief, we're ready.
I'm coming.
(into radio)
Rivers.
(over radio)
Yo.
Begin your reconnoiter.
Inside the building, sadly realizing that the Marlboro pa has only two more to go.  He savors the dregs of his curr number, then suddenly becomes aware of an almost EERIE QU He moves to the window.
Hints of activity in the darkness.  A LIGHT FLARES exting Shadows move on trailer walls.
(spooked, into CB)
Powell?  Al, you still with me? What's going on?  Al?
Powell stiffens.  Robinson looks at him warningly, shakes head.
I'm here, Roy, but I'm, uh, kind of busy.  Let's talk later, okay?
Al, what's wrong?  Did something -- (realizing)
-- Oh, God.  You're coming in!  That's it, isn't it?  Christ, Powell, I told you what you're dealing with here --

I said we'll talk later, Roy.  If you're what I think you are you should know when to listen, when to shut up... and when to pray. Hating himself, Powell DISCONNECTS, watches LIGHTS snaps the parking lot to illuminate the area. Also hating himself, McClane does the same thing.  Pale, moves to a window to watch what he knows is going to be b
He hunches over his communicator.
They'll be coming.  Get ready. Theo, watch the screens.  Be our eyes and ears. (pause)
Wait until they're close.

slips away from the desk, a computer card in his hand.  H meets up with another terrorist and they move behind a sl in the wall.  Eddie waves his card at the sensor and a ME GRID crashes into place.  They hold their weapons behind ready.
All now with earplugs in their CB's, taking up positions:
The SWAT team leader moves in SOP style to the door, scan carefully.
Mitchell listens to CB radio.
(over radio)
We're in position. Mitchell looks at Robinson, who is visible tense.  Robins hesitates, then gives his approval with a nod.
(to CB)
Go.
The SECURITY CAMERAS on the walls PAN and ZOOM:

Kristoff DRILLS AWAY, is rewarded with the message FIFTH DEACTIVATED.  DO YOU WISH TO CONTINUE?  Nearby, Theo sits a bank of monitors.  Screen after screen pinpoints all th police activity outside, down to the last detail.  Theo S Suddenly we RECOGNIZE that tune he's been whistling.  It' "Singin' In The Rain."
(into a throat mike)
It was the night before Xmas, and all through the house, not a creature was stirring, expect for the four assholes coming in the rear in standard 2 X 2 cover formation.
Eddie and another terrorist, ULI, take up prone firing positions, using the gaps in the steel partition like gun
Mitchell and Robinson watch from behind the cover of a po car as the SWAT officers remove a portable welding torch begin cutting their way through the locks.
He moves painfully to the window and looks out.  He can't a thing because of the lights.
(to himself)
No...
Suddenly rifle fire sounds from the building.
(worriedly)
They're shooting at them
(calmly)
It's panic fire...they can't see anything.
(under breath)

They're shooting at the lights. More shots ring out from the building going over the SWAT officers' heads and suddenly the huge dome of one of the spotlights shatters behind Mitchell and Robinson's head. The glow fades.  A moment later the next light twenty fee away dies.
They're going after the lights! The two SWAT officers cutting the garage ate suddenly loo as their cover starts to disappear.
Call them back.
No, they're almost in. Suddenly the third and fourth lights are shot out and the men become sitting ducks.
He calmly speak into his CB.
Don't get impatient.  Just wound them.
Eddie and Uli fire.  They hit one of the officers in the the second one in the arm.
(on radio)
Send in the car! An armored car wheels toward the building and starts towa the wounded men.
JAMES and Alexander quickly load two crates onto the serv elevator and push the button for the 3rd floor.  As the c starts down, they remove an anti-tank gun from one of the crates.
Well, what have we here.  The police've got themselves an R.V. James, Alexander, southeast corner.

The service elevator arrives on the 3rd floor and James a Alexander move across the room toward the windows with th anti-tank weapon.  At the window, they prepare the weapon for use. Outside the window the armored car has stopped in front o wounded man and paramedics quickly load them in from the sheltered side of the vehicle.  Alexander quickly sights the armored car.
(to Hans, CB)
I have them
(o.s., over CB)
Fire.

A blast ROARS from the third floor window and the shell h the armored car.  The car pitches forward like a beast wh front legs have been shot out from under it -- its front destroyed, unable to move.  Alexander looks back at James grins.
He watches from his window.  Coldly picks up his CB.
Hit it again.
listening.  He picks up his CB.
Hans, you motherfucker, you've made your point.  Let them pull back!
Thank you Mr. Cowboy, I'll take it under advisement.  His it again. McClane slumps to the floor below the window.  He feels helpless, then notices his kit bag.
James runs back to the crate on the elevator.
They look on in horror as the armored car sits helplessly fire.  On the police radio channel we HEAR the screams of inside.
(to radio)
Rivers!  Rodriguiz!...Report...
(voice over; on radio, yelling)
This is Rivers.  We've got one dead. Everybody's hit.  Rodriguiz's bleeding bad.  We've got to get the fuck out of here!
(to radio)
Rivers, hang on!  That's an order! Hang on, we'll get you out.
James opens the box of shells and takes two and starts ba across the room.

Like a football.  It sits on the seat of a secretary's ch with castors.  We PULL BACK TO SEE McClane press three detonators into the top, then cover the explosive with a typewriter, tying it securely in place with electrical co
wheels the chair to the service elevator, opens the door block them with a fire axe.  He looks in -- the top of th can just be seen thirty-five floors below.
James hands the shell to Alexander, who expertly loads it the anti-tank gun. Alexaneder lifts the  gun to his shoul and aims.
McClane push the chair into the shaft.

Geronimo...motherfuckers. For a long moment there is nothing, then:  the shaft is f with light, then SOUND -- an ungodly ROAR -- and McClane thrown back across the elevator corridor against the othe back of doors by the concussion wave.
The explosion, like a firestorm, rips across the floor:

head_text.subj: BLOWING OUT THE MACHINE GUN NEXT AND JAMES AND
SENDING DESKS, CHAIRS, PHONES, AND TYPEWRITERS

text: The police take cover behind their cars.  Powell, Robinso and Mitchell look like they've seen the face of God as th building rocks from the blast.  Henry's cigarette falls f his mouth as a desk is sent hurtling across Avenue of the into the trees across the street.
watching it on TV, feeling it all around him.
Oh, Jesus...
Dick Thornburg's crew is taping.
(in awe)
Unreal. (to the cameraman)
Did you get all that?
Yep. Thornburg looks at his competitors still setting up.
Eat your heart out, Channel Four.
The hostages are shaken and the terrorists guarding them aren't too sure of themselves either.  Only Hans is relat calm.
They're using artillery on us -- !
You idiot, it's not the police... (pause)
...It's him.
She comforts Ginny.
He sits up and lifts the CB.
Al!  Al, the guys in the car, did they make it?
on the street, watching as the survivors are pulled out o wreck and to safety.
(on CB)
Safe and sound, thanks to you. What the fuck was that?
The plastique I found. (worried)
Is the building on fire?
No, but it's gonna need one hell of a paint job and a shitload of screen doors. (looking off, nodding)
One spotters say you got two with that blast.
Two?  Are you sure? Before Powell can answer Robinson comes running up to him
Is that him?
Yessir.
(reaching for Powell's
Give me that. (angrily at McClane)

Now, listen to me, mister, I don't know what you think you're doing, but demolishing a building doesn't fall under the definition of 'help'! There's hundreds of people out here and you covered half of them in pieces of glass --
Glass, my ass!  Who the fuck is this?
This is Deputy Chief of Police Dwayne T. Robinson, and I'm in charge of this situation. McClane leans tiredly against the elevator door.

Well, from up here, it looks like you're in charge of shit, Dwayne. I haven't seen such a fucked up operation since the Bride of Frankenstein.  Ask the guys in the armored car if they minded a little flying glass.
Listen asshole -- !
(exploding)

Asshole?  I'm not the one who just for butt fucked on national TV, Dwayne!  Now if you're not part of the solution, stop being part of the problem!  Get off the Goddamn radio and put Al back on! McClane is so furious, he's out of breath.
Argyle nods in agreement.
Tell 'em, Mr. Mac!  Tell 'em!
still seething.  There is a long pause on the CB, then:
Hello, Roy.  How're you feeling?
(pissed)
Pretty fucking unappreciated.
Other officers, including Robinson, monitor the conversat
Hey, I love you. (looking around)
So do a lot of the guys.  So hang in there, man.  Hang in there.
(tired, touched)
Thanks...partner.
As it SNAPS ON.  We're in the studio set.
(as the picture stabilizes)

...of the Nakatomi building, sources say that the terrorist leader 'Hans' may be this man, Hans Gruber. A SLIDE of Hans appears behind her.  At the same time, th PULLS BACK.  We realize we're on THE HOSTAGE FLOOR, and H has just turned on the set out here for his "guests".  He modestly as they "recognize" him from the on air shot, re to the office.
(on TV)

A member of the radical West German Volksfrei movement. Strangely, the Volksfrei leadership issued a communique an hour ago stating that Gruber has been expelled from the organization and is operating on his own.
(on TV)

Obviously, Gail whatever his affiliation, it's safe to say that Gruber's terrorist actions in Los Angeles tonight are well, terroristic... As the bullshit continues, Ellis suddenly STANDS, head to the terrorist "office".  Immediately the chief guard here Fritz, moves to intercept Ellis.
Where are you going?
I'm tired of sitting here waiting to see who gets us killed first... them...or your husband. (to the approaching Fritz)
Hi there.
(worried)
What are you going to do?
Hey, I negotiate million dollar deals for breakfast.  I can handle these clowns. (to Fritz)
I want to talk to Hans.  Hans! Sprickenzie talk? He doesn't wait for an answer.  Fritz follows him.  Holly worries.
(in mid-speech, angry)
-- you wouldn't let me kill him when I had the chance --
If you'd listened to me he would be neutralized already!
I don't want neutral...I want dead -- ALL TURN at a rap on the door.  Ellis is there.
Hope I'm not interrupting...?
(to Fritz)
What does he want? As Fritz shrugs:

It's not what I want, it's what I can give you.  Look, let's be straight, okay?  It's obvious you're not some dumb thug up here to snatch a few purses, am I right? Karl looks at Ellis and then at Hans, as if to say, let m this asshole right now.  But Hans is either amused of cur or bored enough to shake his head, turn back to Ellis.
(politely)
You're very perceptive.
(flattered)

Hey, I read the papers, I watch 60 minutes, I say to myself, these guys are professionals, they're motivated, they're happening. They want something.  Now, personally, I don't care about your politics. Maybe you're pissed at the Camel Jockeys, maybe it's the Hebes, Northern Ireland, that's none of my business.  I figure, You're here to negotiate, am I right?
You're amazing.  You figured this all out already?

Hey, business is business.  You use a gun, I use a fountain pen, what's the difference?  To put it in my terms, you're here on a hostile takeover and you grab us for some greenmail but you didn't expect a poison pill was gonna be running around the building. (smiling)
Hans, baby...I'm your white knight.
(dryly)
I must have missed 60 Minutes.  What are you saying?
The guy upstairs who's fucking things up?  I can give him to you. As Hans reacts with real interest for the first time, we:
By the CB.  He suddenly REACTS to a GROAN from McClane.
Roy!  You all right?
He's by an open desk drawer, having just ripped open a pa of twinkies he's found.  He grimaces, mouth full.
Yeah, just trying to handle some year old twinkies.  Yucck.  What do they put in these things?
(reciting)
'Sugar, enriched flour, partially hydrogenated vegetable oil, polysorbate 60 and yellow dye #5.'
(laughing)
You sound like a man with a couple of kids.

Not yet, the wife in working on our first.  You got any kids back on the ranch? McClane swallows Twinkie with a grimace, takes out his wa flips it open to a picture of himself and Holly and the k in happier days.
Two.  And I'd sure like to see them swinging on the jungle gym with Al junior.
It's a date.  You buy the ice cream. McClane laughs, stares at the photo, when suddenly anothe besides Powell's comes over his radio.
(o.s., on CB)
Touching, cowboy, touching. (pause)
Or should I call you Mister McClane? Mister officer John McClane on the
McClane FREEZES.  How much do they know?
Reacts, gleeful, writes down the name.
(to Mary)
Get on the phone to our New York affiliate...move, move!
reacts, signals an Aide, who's already writing, too.
(fighting to stay calm)
Sister Teresa in third grade called me Mr. McClane.  My friends call me John Mac.  You're neither...shithead.
I have someone who wants to talk to you.  A very special friend who was at the party with you tonight. McClane's face falls.  Oh, God.  Eyes closed, he waits fo voice that tells him it's all over.
Hello, John boy? McClane's eyes open, showing equal parts of shock and hop In the office, CAMERA ADJUSTS TO SHOW Ellis as Hans gives the CB.
Ellis? Ellis has a cigarette, and a terrorist brings him a Diet

John, they're giving me a few minutes to try and talk some sense into you. I know you think you're doing your job, and I can appreciate that, but you're just dragging this thing out. None of us gets out of here until these people can negotiate with the LA police, and they're just not gonna start doing that until you stop messing up the works.
(carefully)
Ellis, what have you told them?
I told them we're old friends and you were my guest at the party. McClane sighs, partially relieved.  Hans meanwhile, narro eyes.
Ellis...you shouldn't be doing this...
